ceVlanIdList.description: The list of cvlanId(s) that map to this UNI CE End Point

ingressBWProfile.description: The list of ingress bandwidth profile specs per CosId

egressBWProfile.description: The list of egress bandwidth profile specs per CosId

vlanIdListType.description: Vlan ID types, ALL for all vlan IDs, LIST for a list of Vlan IDs, EXCEPT for all Vlan IDs except the listed.

cosId.description: The class of service identifier to which this bandwidth profile spec is applied.

cir.description: CIR - Committed Information Rate - It defines the average rate in Mbps or Gbps of Service or ENNI Frames up to which the network delivers Service or ENNI Frames and meets the performance objectives defined by the CoS Service Attribute.  It is an integer >= 0, but MUST allow configuration to support CIR values up to 70% of the UNI speed, in the following increments:   1-10 Mb/s, increments of 1 Mb/s   10-100 Mb/s, increments of 10 Mb/s   100-1000 Mb/s, increments of 100 Mb/s   1-10 Gb/s, increments  of 1 Gb/s

cbs.description: CBS â€“ Committed Burst Size - It limits the maximum number of bytes available for a burst of Service or ENNI Frames sent at the EI speed to remain CIR- conformant.  It is an integer and MUST be >=12176.

eir.description: EIR - Excess Information Rate - EIR is a Bandwidth Profile parameter. It defines the average rate in Mbps/Gbps of Service or ENNI Frames up to which the network may deliver Service or Network Frames but without any performance objectives.  It is an integer value >= 0

ebs.description: EBS - Excess Burst Size - It limits the maximum number of bytes available for a burst of Service or ENNI Frames sent at the EI speed to remain EIR- conformant.  It is an integer >= 0.

colorMode.description: CM - Color Mode - The Color Mode parameter indicates whether the color-aware or color-blind property is employed by the Bandwidth Profile. It takes a value of "color-blind" or "color-aware" only.

couplingFlag.description: The Bandwidth Profile parameter that determines whether overflow tokens not used for Service Frames declared Green can be used as Yellow tokens.
